meanings.definition: Resembling a ligule in shape or form.
meanings.sent1: The tiny flower had a liguloid petal at its base.
meanings.sent2: The plant's leaves had a liguloid appearance, tapering to a point.
meanings.sent3: The liguloid shape of the cloud made it look like a fluffy feather.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was liguloid, spreading outwards like a gentle curve.
meanings.sent5: The liguloid design of the logo made it easily recognizable.

meanings.definition: Having characteristics similar to a ligule.
meanings.sent1: The caterpillar's movement was liguloid, inching along slowly.
meanings.sent2: The bird's beak had a liguloid shape, perfect for catching insects.
meanings.sent3: The liguloid pattern on the fabric reminded her of tiny leaves.
meanings.sent4: His speech had a liguloid quality, flowing smoothly and gracefully.
meanings.sent5: The liguloid texture of the skin felt soft and velvety to the touch.
